bug.short_desc: SELinux is preventing systemd-localed from 'execute' accesses on the file /usr/lib/systemd/libsystemd-shared-231.so.
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: SELinux is preventing systemd-localed from 'execute' accesses on the file /usr/lib/systemd/libsystemd-shared-231.so.
***** Plugin catchall (100. confidence) suggests **************************
If you believe that systemd-localed should be allowed execute access on the libsystemd-shared-231.so file by default. Then you should report this as a bug. You can generate a local policy module to allow this access. Do allow this access for now by executing: # ausearch -c 'systemd-localed' --raw | audit2allow -M my-systemdlocaled # semodule -X 300 -i my-systemdlocaled.pp
Additional Information: Source Context system_u:system_r:systemd_localed_t:s0 Target Context system_u:object_r:init_exec_t:s0 Target Objects /usr/lib/systemd/libsystemd-shared-231.so [ file ] Source systemd-localed Source Path systemd-localed Port <Unknown> Host (removed) Source RPM Packages Target RPM Packages systemd-231-1.fc25.x86_64 Policy RPM selinux-policy-3.13.1-204.fc25.noarch Selinux Enabled True Policy Type targeted Enforcing Mode Permissive Host Name (removed) Platform Linux (removed) 4.7.0-2.fc25.x86_64 #1 SMP Tue Jul 26 14:26:55 UTC 2016 x86_64 x86_64 Alert Count 3 First Seen 2016-07-28 17:14:08 CEST Last Seen 2016-07-28 17:17:33 CEST Local ID 2d4049dc-4f45-4015-92d3-fe2b93bcb6d7
Raw Audit Messages type=AVC msg=audit(1469719053.855:249): avc: denied { execute } for pid=1633 comm="systemd-localed" path="/usr/lib/systemd/libsystemd-shared-231.so" dev="dm-0" ino=796355 scontext=system_u:system_r:systemd_localed_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:object_r:init_exec_t:s0 tclass=file permissive=1
Hash: systemd-localed,systemd_localed_t,init_exec_t,file,execute
Version-Release number of selected component: selinux-policy-3.13.1-204.fc25.noarch
Additional info: reporter: libreport-2.7.2 hashmarkername: setroubleshoot kernel: 4.7.0-2.fc25.x86_64 type: libreport

Looks like a mislabeled file.
ls -lZ /usr/lib/systemd/libsystemd-shared-231.so -rwxr-xr-x. 1 root root system_u:object_r:lib_t:s0 2220696 Aug 3 14:49 /usr/lib/systemd/libsystemd-shared-231.so
matchpathcon /usr/lib/systemd/libsystemd-shared-231.so /usr/lib/systemd/libsystemd-shared-231.so system_u:object_r:lib_t:s0
What happens if you run
restorecon -v /usr/lib/systemd/libsystemd-shared-231.so

As of selinux-policy-3.13.1-207.fc25, restorecon -v /usr/lib/systemd/libsystemd-shared-231.so does not change the file label. It still reads
-rwxr-xr-x. 1 root root system_u:object_r:lib_t:s0 2216600 Aug 3 20:48 /usr/lib/systemd/libsystemd-shared-231.so*
However, no alert is triggered for current Fedora development 25 any longer. I guess it disappeared for selinux-policy-3.13.1-205.fc25.
